summary: This document is a chain of emails between Assistant U.S. Attorneys in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing the handling of Touhy requests from victims of Jeffrey Epstein involved in civil litigation. The correspondence details internal coordination on responding to requests for documents, legal strategy regarding document production, and interactions with victims' counsel, including Roberta Kaplan. It reveals the government's process for managing sensitive information from criminal investigations in the context of civil discovery.

persons.name: Steven Kochevar
persons.context: Primary point of contact for handling Touhy requests from Epstein victims; drafts and coordinates response letters and document productions with other AUSAs and victims' counsel.

persons.name: John McEnany
persons.context: Senior AUSA providing guidance and approval on Touhy request procedures and legal strategy, including discussions on jurisdiction and document disclosure.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: AUSA involved in coordinating responses to Touhy requests, communicating with victims' counsel, and ensuring deadlines are met.

persons.name: David Jones
persons.context: AUSA consulted on the reasonableness of the approach to handling Touhy requests, particularly regarding referrals to other U.S. Attorney's Offices.

persons.name: Roberta Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney representing an Epstein victim (plaintiff) in civil litigation; recipient of initial Touhy process letter from the SDNY USAO.

persons.name: Maria Lacerda
persons.context: Identified in the emails as a Jane Doe victim who is a plaintiff in a civil suit and has made a Touhy request for documents; mentioned in context of immunity discussions from the S.D. Fla. investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the criminal investigation; the subject of the document requests from victims involved in civil litigation against his estate.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: Referred to as a 'wiser Touhy head' in the civil division to be consulted on complex jurisdictional questions regarding Touhy requests.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: AUSA who signed off on a letter and document production in response to a Touhy request from an Epstein victim.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: AUSA who signed off on a letter and document production in response to a Touhy request from an Epstein victim.

persons.name: Jeffrey O
persons.context: Mentioned by John McEnany as the person he spoke to about continuing to use Steven Kochevar as the point of contact for Touhy requests.

persons.name: Rossmiller
persons.context: Mentioned in draft Touhy language as the initial recipient of a request for information, with Steven Kochevar taking over handling.

connections.description: Frequent email correspondence showing Kochevar seeking McEnany's guidance and approval on legal strategy and document production for Touhy requests.
Collaborate on handling Touhy requests, planning calls with victims' counsel, and ensuring document productions are completed.
Kochevar is the government attorney responsible for sending formal Touhy response letters to Kaplan, who represents an Epstein victim in civil litigation.
McEnany references that Jones thought a particular approach to handling a Touhy request was reasonable.
Kochevar is handling the Touhy request submitted by Lacerda, an Epstein victim, for documents related to the investigation.
McEnany states he spoke to Jeffrey O about designating Steven Kochevar as the point of contact for Touhy requests.

events.title: Touhy Response Letter and Document Production
events.description: Steven Kochevar circulates a draft letter and documents to be produced in response to a Touhy request from an Epstein victim who is a plaintiff in a civil suit.

events.title: Follow-up on Epstein Victim Touhy Request
events.description: Kochevar informs the team that the requester has submitted a lengthy list of follow-up questions and demands. The team plans to have a call with counsel to explain no further production will be made, and will refer them to N.D. Ga. or S.D. Fla. for materials from the Florida investigation.

events.title: Designation of Touhy Point of Contact
events.description: John McEnany emails that he spoke to Jeffrey O about continuing to use Steven Kochevar as the point of contact for Touhy requests related to Jeffrey Epstein from civil plaintiffs.

events.title: Draft Initial Letter to Roberta Kaplan
events.description: Steven Kochevar circulates a draft initial letter to Roberta Kaplan at Kaplan Hecker outlining the Touhy process for requesting information related to Epstein.

keyFacts: The SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office had an established process for handling Touhy requests (requests for government information in third-party litigation) from victims of Jeffrey Epstein involved in civil suits.
The government was coordinating responses with the 'Maxwell team,' indicating ongoing criminal proceedings related to Ghislaine Maxwell were a factor in document disclosure decisions.

Internal discussions reveal the government did not possess files from the U.S. Attorney's Office in S.D. Fla. related to the earlier Epstein investigation, partly to avoid conflict issues and the appearance of stepping into a district bound by a prior non-prosecution agreement.
A victim identified in the emails is Maria Lacerda, who was seeking documents, including materials related to purported immunity discussions concerning her from the S.D. Fla. investigation.
The correspondence shows careful legal strategy to limit document production, citing grand jury secrecy (Rule 6(e)), law enforcement privilege, and the need to protect ongoing investigations.
